intro: Coffea krugii, commonly known as the Kruge's coffee or the Kruge coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the highlands of Ethiopia and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that contain two to four seeds, which are used to make coffee. It thrives in cool, shaded environments and is typically found at elevations above 1,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and unique characteristics, it is considered a rare and valuable species in the coffee world.
